title: Revolt - NEW typeface
content:
Hello,

This is first digital sketch for my NEW display typeface - Revolt Display. Any comment please.

Thank you.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123034923im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Revolt_6231.png)
author: Lasko Dzurovski

comments.content: You shouldn’t go on with that.
Go with a bold version instead and it will be a interesting display font.

The name looks wrong to me. The type is fanciful and very, very non-revolutionary. English meaning could also be a problem: look up "revolt", "revolution" and "revulsion" in a dictionary. That said, I quite like the letter shapes.
beautiful shapes! I'm not sure what the first comments were about but, I don't see much not to like here. in my case, I'm just not sure when I'd get to use such a delicate design.
I think it would help if you post the whole set of letter, number, symbol and etc... so we could comment and give you good feedback.

After almost 3 years i continue to work on this font.  
I change the name - Roseta. Comments are welcome.  
Thank you.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123034923im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Roseta_4169.png)

Very Victorian!  
Unfortunately, the name is too much like the foundry.

Very nice!

But I'm with Nick on the name... What about Rosaria?

BTW Andreas, is it that you are -or were- seeing too much similarity with an existing font?

hhp

Thank you Nick and Hrant. Here is new name and some glyphs.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123034923im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Rosaria_6435.png)

@ Nick Shinn: Thank you Nick. This name i use for working files.  
I probably change name before final version.
